laboratory_examinations.findings: Testosterone levels were in the pubertal range, 6.5 ng/ml, 5.6 ng/ml, 1.5 ng/ml, 7.4 ng/ml, and 4.6 ng/ml for patients F, P1, M1, M2 respectively at clinical onset.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Testosterone levels decreased to less than 0.4 ng/ml during ketoconazole treatment but later increased again after cessation of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Low AMH levels at diagnosis, elevated after testosterone suppression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: AMH levels increased to prepubertal range during ketoconazole administration.

laboratory_examinations.findings: High inhibin B levels were observed throughout the observation period.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Inhibin B levels remained elevated from clinical onset to adolescence, irrespective of testosterone levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Pan-/H9251C-inhibin levels were also in the pubertal range.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Levels remained high throughout follow-up, unaffected by testosterone fluctuations.

laboratory_examinations.findings: FSH levels were undetectable or less than 0.2 IU/liter, indicating suppression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Responses to LHRH provocative tests were low.
